1.text: He that separateth himself seeketh his own desire, and rageth against all sound wisdom.

2.text: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but only that his heart may reveal itself.

3.text: When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, and with ignominy cometh reproach.

4.text: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters; the wellspring of wisdom is as a flowing brook.

5.text: To accept the person of the wicked is not good, nor to turn aside the righteous in judgment.

6.text: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for stripes.

7.text: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

8.text: The words of a whisperer are as dainty, morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

9.text: He also that is slack in his work is brother to him that is a destroyer.

10.text: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

11.text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own imagination.

12.text: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour goeth humility.

13.text: He that giveth answer before he heareth, it is folly and shame unto him.

14.text: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a broken spirit who can bear?

15.text: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

16.text: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

17.text: He that pleadeth his cause first seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him out.

18.text: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

19.text: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and such contentions are like the bars of a castle.

20.text: A man’s belly shall be filled with the fruit of his mouth; with the increase of his lips shall he be satisfied.

21.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

22.text: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.

23.text: The poor useth entreaties: but the rich answereth roughly.

24.text: He that maketh many friends doeth it to his own destruction: but there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
